{{Use mdy dates|date=November 2014}}
'''Ty Taylor''' is an American [[auctioneer]], author, [[cowboy]], and musician.

==Music career==

Ty Taylor is a [[country singer]], songwriter, and record producer<ref name="Taylor">{{cite book |first=Ty|last=Taylor|title=Take Me As I Am|year=1995|publisher=Powder River Productions}}</ref> who has performed on the ''[[Grand Ole Opry]]'' and ''[[Austin City Limits]]'' while working for [[Loretta Lynn]] and [[Doug Stone]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.workman.com/authors/ty_taylor/|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303232834/www.workman.com/authors/ty_taylor/|archive-date=2016-03-03|title=ABOUT TY TAYLOR}}</ref><ref name="Taylor and Hartnagle-Taylor">{{cite book|first1 = Jeanne Joy | last1 = Hartnagle-Taylor | first2 = Ty | last2 = Taylor |year = 2010|title=Stockdog Savvy|publisher=Alpine Publications|isbn=978-1-57779-106-5}}</ref>

Taylor started singing and playing guitar when he was ten years old, spurred on by his mother, a musician herself, who encouraged him to pursue music.<ref name=countrynights>{{citation|last=Madsen|first=Carol A.|title=Ty Taylor, A Man Who Sings From the Heart|date=November 1992|page=15|publisher=Country Nights Magazine}}</ref> In 1991, he made his debut as a [[country singer]] at the [[Texas State Fair]]. Prior to that time, Taylor toured nationally with various groups ranging from contemporary Christian rock, to country. From 1991 to 1995, he was based out of Colorado<ref name="Hartnagle-Taylor">{{cite book |first=Jeanne Joy |last= Hartnagle-Taylor|title=Greasepaint Matadors|year=1993|publisher=Alpine Publications|isbn=0-931866-56-1}}</ref> and toured the country with his Powder River Band.

Taylor gained national acclaim for his vocals when he performed with country artists such as [[Loretta Lynn]], [[Johnny Lee (singer)|Johnny Lee]], [[Vern Gosdin]], [[Tammy Wynette]], [[Crystal Gayle]], and [[Doug Stone]]. He has also opened for [[Chris LeDoux]], [[Mark Chesnutt]], [[Tanya Tucker]], [[Billy Ray Cyrus]], [[Daron Norwood]], [[Diamond Rio]], [[Clay Walker]], [[Tim McGraw]], and [[Charlie Daniels]]. He credits artists like [[George Jones]], [[Merle Haggard]], and [[Bob Wills]] as important musical influences.

==In the recording studio==

Ty is a traditionalist merging [[honky-tonk]] and [[western swing]] tunes with his own original material to develop the unique sound he is known for on his album ''Take Me As I Am''.<ref name="Taylor"/> He has also recorded demos, radio [[jingle]]s, and background vocals for other recording artists.<ref name=countrynights/> This talent led him to produce records for other artists.

==As A tribute artist==

Since 1995, Ty Taylor has performed as a [[George Strait]] [[tribute act]]<ref>{{citation|title=George Strait Tribute Adds Texas Swing|date=February 24, 2007|publisher=Cumberland Times-News|url=http://times-news.com/archive/x1540387270}}</ref> in [[Branson, Missouri]] at the Christy Lane Theater, on the [[Grand Ole Opry]] stage, [[Gaylord Opryland Resort & Convention Center]], and "Live at the Riverfront" during the [[CMA Music Festival]] in [[Nashville, Tennessee]].

==As A cowboy author==

Ty is also a real life [[cowboy]].  When he is not entertaining, he rides, ropes, and trains his [[Australian shepherd]]s and other [[cowdog]]s on his ranch.

In 2010, he collaborated on an educational and entertaining training book for [[herding dog]] enthusiasts, ''Stockdog Savvy'', with short stories about [[stock dog]]s and their owners.<ref name="Taylor and Hartnagle-Taylor"/><ref>[http://www.onlinedigitalpubs.com/display_article.php?id=528426 Western Horseman Magazine â€“ October 2010]</ref>

==As A professional auctioneer==

Taylor received the [[title of honor|honorary title]] of [[colonel]] in 2006 when he graduated from the Missouri [[Auction School]].<ref>News Release, November 6, 2006, Missouri Auction School</ref>
